title: 1969 Triumph TR6

description: Up for sale is a fine example of the iconic and legendary British sports car, the Triumph TR6.

The car looks and runs great. It's rare white finish is an older respray and has a few flaws here and there but still presents very well. The interior is in very good condition with nice seats, carpet and door panels. All of the lights and gauges are working and the four speaker stereo rocks! The top is in good condition with a few small patches but still fits well and will keep you dry. A top boot and full cockpit cover come with the car. The jack and tools are present as is a full size spare.

The car starts right up, warms up quickly and idles steady. The car accelerates nicely and shifts smoothly through all four gears. The exhaust has an aggressive roar under heavy foot and a bit of a gurgle on deceleration that makes me smile. Brakes are strong. The car tracks nice and straight down the road. It runs cool in the Texas heat, no sweat. Tires are about 75%.

This was the final year of the TR6, discontinued because its 2.5 liter straight six couldn't meet the new emissions standards. Like all Triumph engines, this one has lots of low end torque making it a blast to drive.
This is dry and rust free Oklahoma car. It is not pristine but is as nice a driver as you may find. Many more pictures available upon request.

This car is located in Rowlett, Texas and is offered as is where is. Texas residents may be subject to sales tax. If the ad is running the car is available. Scammers and sales assistants need not apply. Call text or reply.
title: 1976 Triumph TR6

description: 1976 was the final year for the successful Triumph TR6 which was considered a modern classic during all years of construction beginning in 1968. The TR series was much loved here in the USA with Triumph clubs popping up all over the continent. Owners formed bonds with one another and their cars were shown, raced, toured, and repaired together. Today these cars are reminders of a simpler bygone era. This Red/Black classic is a numbers-matching original. Power is supplied via the 2.5-Litre Inline-6 mated to a 4-speed manual transmission. Additional features include semi-trailing arm independent rear suspension, rack and pinion steering, 15-inch wheels and tires, pile carpeted floors and trunk/boot, bucket seats, and a gorgeous walnut veneer dash. The Triumph TR6 makes a great first-time collector car, parts are readily available, club support is still good, and you will experience traditional open top British motorcar touring. This beautiful TR6 is located at our Milwaukee showroom. You can view this vehicle in greater detail including HD pictures and an HD video of it running and driving at Gatewayclassiccars.som. If you are interested in purchasing this vehicle or have more questions regarding it, please call us at (262) 891-4253 or email Milwaukee@gatewayclassiccars.com.

title: 1972 Triumph TR6

description: 1973 Triumph TR-6 Convertible. It has a newer cherry red paint job, runs great and sounds amazing. Wooden steering wheel and shift knob, wooden dash with no cracks or chips. Upgraded with a CD/stereo and speakers behind the seats. Includes a tonneau cover and indoor car cover. Panasport alloy wheels look new. Plenty of tread on the tires. All gauges are OEM Smiths/Lucas and function, with the exception of the fuel gauge, which always reads empty. Car pulls strong in all gears, and has a padded roll bar with a windscreen built in. I've put about $ 7,000 into the car in the last year. Here's what was done: new alternator, new clutch, replaced water pump, replaced master brake cylinder, remove stub axles and replace seals. rear end assembly removed, all mounts replaced and assembly welded back onto car (common stress joint in these cars - rear end will separate if this isn't done eventually), replaced steering rack kit and mounting bushings (entire front steering rack system redone). No rust, no body damage. Car also comes will ALL FOUR ORIGINAL WHEELS with caps and NEW TIRES if you'd like them. You'll need to arrange for transport for the wheels and tires (already mounted) separately from the car.

description: This 1976 Triumph TR6 with overdrive transmission is a 2-owner survivor. The car has 90% original paint (paint blend on left rear fender) and all original mechanical and body parts. Paint is slightly flat and needs a deep polish. The interior is original except for carpets. There is a recent top to factory specs with reflector trim. The previous owner, who had it for approximately 35 years, generally drove it between 100 and 200 miles per year, on average, with documentation to prove it. He had the vehicle serviced every year. We just serviced the car with four new redline tires, alignment, new front shocks, new rear brakes, four rubber brake lines, new brake fluid, oil and filter, transmission service, rear end fluid, and checked rear shocks, full and like new. This car runs and drives like new and everything appears to work perfectly. Ready for fall cruising for the bargain price of $14,900.

description: Gateway Classic Cars of Scottsdale is delighted to offer this sophisticated 1974 Triumph TR6 for sale. This marvelous car from the mother land is a real fun roadster to drive around. Under the bonnet of this sharp ride is a 2.5 L Inline six which is a real ace. Inside this wicked car is a 4-speed manual transmission with overdrive, seat belts, radio, and leather seats. This old girl has Amco wind deflectors as well and she does not coast a bomb, therefore she is a bloody good buy. The interior also has a wood fascia, that is dashboard for you Americans. As stated this is a convertible roadster and is a great car for driving down the country side with your best mate. Driving this roadster along makes you want to say tally-ho or cheerio to make you feel more like an Englishman. The exterior paint job on this car is white but the most important part is on the rear driver side wing is a flag from the mother land so show pride on where this triumphant Triumph comes from. The leather seats in the beauty is brown, with black floormats and accents around the wood fascia. To boot in the boot is a four way to remove the tire, and yes, I included that just to say boot. Our 1974 Triumph TR6 for sale includes: Seatbelts, tonneau cover, AM/FM radio, leather interior, convertible top, overdrive on the transmission, full size spare tire, and Amco wind deflectors. To see 100-plus pictures and a video of this fast 1974 Triumph TR6 for sale, please visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com. title: 1974 Triumph TR6

description: The Atlanta Showroom is offering this 1969 Triumph TR-6.  This Triumph has beautiful black paint and knock off wheel mounting along with a rear shock conversion.  This electronic overdrive 4 speed has great running in-line 6 powering this British sports car.  The TR6 is a big car compared to many two seaters of the era, and this helps to give it an air of solidity that can be lacking in smaller alternatives. Certainly, there are far fewer rattles than on something like a contemporary Spitfire. There was no rear seat on the TR6, but the cabin was built for two people to travel in fair comfort. There is plenty of elbow room, a convenient luggage space behind the seats and room for lanky legs to stretch.  The fixtures and fittings are not opulent, but they do have a fair sense of luxury about them. They are traditional too with the dash layout with the large rev counter and speedo dead ahead with minor gauges mounted centrally harping right back to the TR2. The seats are comfortable and durable.  The carÃ¢??s size means there is never any danger of getting that traditional bum-six-inchesoff- the-road feeling. Instead it feels more of a grand tourer than an out and out hell-raiser. The steering is fairly accurate and light on the move. Power delivery from the six-pot engine is smooth and refined, and more than sufficient to make the tail squat down when you boot the throttle.  The front anti-roll bar helps make the handling more predictable.  The good feedback from the road to the driver is excellent, so hustling a TR6 becomes a test of driver skill and control rather than a lottery. If cruising is your game, the overdrive is geared to place 100mph easily within your grasp. And there is more than enough torque available to dispatch motorway overtaking with nothing more than a flick of the switch into direct drive.  Options include: Manual top, wire wheels, vinyl interior, radial tires.  To view the car in greater detail, including 100+ HD photos and HD video, please visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com. For more information please call the Atlanta showroom at 678-894-4833.

title: 1967 Triumph TR6

description: The Triumph TR6 was a best-selling British sports car built between 1968 and 1976. It has long been the favorite of British sports car aficionados around the world thanks to its good looks, great handling and solid performance. The number of car clubs dedicated to the car attest to its popularity.     This 1969 Triumph TR6 represents the breed especially well. Looking great in green and black, it draws attention without shouting. The engine moves the car with alacrity, humming smoothly under the hood and transferring power to the wheels through a well-matched four speed manual transmission. This is a driving machine, and the whole experience of the car reinforces that impression.     If you're the previous owner of a TR6, and rue the day you sold the car, this is your chance to turn back time. Live those top-down glory days once again. For those of you who have never yet owned a TR6, this is your chance to join the club--literally. You will enjoy the car itself, of course, but you might be surprised at how much you also enjoy the camaraderie of fellow British sports car enthusiasts. It's like a family, and you'll be warmly welcomed.    Don't just stand there on the outside looking in! Call Art & Speed today at (901) 850-0507. We'd love to introduce you to some friends.

description: The Triumph TR6 (1969–76) was a British six-cylinder sports car and the best-seller of the TR range built by Triumph when production ended in July 1976. This record was then surpassed by the TR7. 91,850 TR6s were built.

All TR6 sports cars featured inline six-cylinder engines. For the US market the engine was carburetted, as had been the US-only TR250 model's engine. For other world markets including England, the TR6 was fuel-injected as had been the non-US market TR5. The Lucas mechanical fuel injection system helped the home-market TR6 produce 150 bhp at model introduction. Later the non-US TR6 variant was detuned to 125 hp in order for it to be easier to drive, while the US-variant continued to be carburetted with a mere 104 hp.

The TR6 featured a four speed manual transmission. An optional equipment overdrive unit was a desirable feature because it gave drivers close-gearing for aggressive driving, yet "long legs" for open motorways. TR6 also featured independent rear suspension, rack and pinion steering, fifteen inch wheels and tires, pile carpet on floors and boot, bucket seats, and a full complement of instrumentation. Braking was accomplished by disc brakes in the front; drum brakes in the rear. A factory steel hard top was optional. TR6 construction was fundamentally old-fashioned: the body was bolted onto a frame instead of the two being integrated into a unibody structure; the TR6 dashboard was wooden (plywood w/ veneer).
Besides the TR250 and TR5, the TR6 was also preceded by a series of four-cylinder Triumph TRs: TR2, TR3, TR3A, TR4, and TR4A. TR6 was succeeded by the four-cylinder TR7 and the eight-cylinder TR8.
The Triumph TR6 is supported by active clubs and reliable service parts suppliers.

This very nice example has been restored to a very nice, near show quality level. The Interior and brightwork are without fault, the top is new, the wheels and tires are excellent, and the car is rust free with a nicely detailed engine compartment and undercarriage. While the paint is quite nice, its not a concours paint job. Upon close inpection there are a few minor dings here and there, and an occassional run.
A triple Weber Carb set up, which evidently was used in Europe for Rallying and includes a beefer Cam and dual exhaust, and a Roll bar have been added.
This is one of the better Tr6's we have had the opportunity to represent. This is a fine example that will provide years of driving enjoyment.
